sentences: Neal Zaslaw (born  June 28, 1939) is an American musicologist.
Born in New York, Zaslaw graduated from Harvard in 1961 with a BA and obtained his master's from Juilliard in 1963.
He played flute in the American Symphony Orchestra under Leopold Stokowski from 1962 to 1965.
D from Columbia University; he also taught at CUNY, 1968-70.
Since 1970 he has taught at Cornell University.
Zaslaw has done extended work on the works of Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, including a landmark 1989 work on his symphonies.
In 1993, he was named the principal editor of the revised KÃ¶chel catalogue.
